Plants of region or era
a long strip or large area especially of land
that lives both on land and in water but must produce its eggs in water
describes something that has many small holes, so liquid or air can pass through, especially slowly
to give something in order to provide or achieve something together with other people
to prevent something from continuing as usual or as expected
cannot have babies, produce young, or produce new plants
something left after other parts have been taken away
to do away with completely, without leaving a trace

a long period when there is little or no rain
the act of sending out gas, heat, light, etc.
to make something possible or easier
the number and types of plants and animals that exist in a particular area
too special, unusual, or valuable to replace with something or someone else
